settings.editor: A gym, short for gymnasium, is an open air or covered location for gymnastics, athletics, and gymnastic services. The word is derived from the ancient Greek gymnasium. They are commonly found in athletic and fitness centers, and as activity and learning spaces in educational institutions. "Gym" is also slang for "fitness center", which is often an indoor facility.

settings.description_text: CrossFit appeals to both men and women alike and a 2014 statistical analysis showed that CrossFit participants were equally 50% male and 50% female.
Yoga (/ˈjoʊɡə/;)  is a group of physical, mental, and spiritual practices or disciplines which originated in ancient India.
Dance is a performing art form consisting of purposefully selected sequences of human movement. This movement has aesthetic and symbolic value.

settings.title: Good, better, best. Never let it rest. Until your good is better and your better is best.

tabs.tab_content:
10:00am - 10:45am
Pure Cycle
Exercise Type: Cardio

Gymnasia apparatus such as bar-bells, parallel bars, jumping board, running path, tennis-balls, cricket field, fencing area, and so forth are used as exercises. In safe weather, outdoor locations are the most conducive to health. Gyms were popular in ancient Greece. Their curricula included Gymnastica militaria or self-defense, gymnastica medica, or physical therapy to help the sick and injured, and gymnastica athletica for physical fitness and sports, from boxing to dance


11:00am - 11:45am
Pure Pump
Exercise Type: Strength

These gymnasia also had teachers of wisdom and philosophy. Community gymnastic events were done as part of the celebrations during various village festivals. In ancient Greece there was a phrase of contempt, "He can neither swim nor write." After a while, however, Olympic athletes began training in buildings just for them.


13:00am - 13:45am
Pure Combat
Exercise Type: Strength

These gymnasia also had teachers of wisdom and philosophy. Community gymnastic events were done as part of the celebrations during various village festivals. In ancient Greece there was a phrase of contempt, "He can neither swim nor write." After a while, however, Olympic athletes began training in buildings just for them.
